did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: Collection contains original research materials and published papers of Leonid M. Ozernoy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Leonid M. Ozernoy papers, Collection #C0083, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Maryanne Ozernoy in 2004.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives Staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Born in 1939, Leonid M. Ozernoy taught in the School of Computational Sciences and Informatics at GMU from 1993 to 2002. Born in Moscow, Ozernoy was one of the former Soviet Union's refusniks and came to the United States in 1986. He worked at Boston University and Harvard University before coming to the Washington, D.C., area in the early 1990s to join NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland as a consultant. At George Mason, he taught courses in computational sciences and physics, such as Colloquium on Computational Sciences and Informatics, Astrophysics, and Modern Astronomy. Ozernoy's research involved the dynamics and structure of interplanetary dust, the physics of nonthermal processes in active galaxies and quasars, the dynamics of compact stellar systems, astrophysics of black holes, the formation of galaxies and large-scale structures in the universe, and observational cosmology. Ozernoy's honors included election as Fellow of the American Physical Society and Fellow of the Royal Astronomical Society in London. He also received the National Research Council-NASA Research Associateship Award in 1991. He died in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains original research materials and published papers of Leonid M. Ozernoy. Also there are 20 35mm color slides on the solar system.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by subject.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds personal paper collections from many other George Mason University professors.
